prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Summarized Context:
The witness Sorin is recalling how he was stabbed. We know previously that Sorin was stabbed with the candelabra.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Trucy Wright
Description: My adopted daughter. She's been skyrocketing her way toward being a top-class magician.
Character 1
Name: Athena Cykes
Description: The newest lawyer in my office with a background in psychology.
Character 2
Name: Larry Butz
Description: An old friend of mine and an aspiring picture book author. As we used to say, when something smells, it's usually the Butz.
Character 3
Name: Ellen Wyatt
Description: My client in this case. Larry brought her to me. She works as a maid for the Sprocket family.
Character 4
Name: Ema Skye
Description: A detective friend of mine. She's finally achieved her dream of being a forensics investigator.
Character 5
Name: Maya Fey
Description: A practitioner of the Kurain Channeling Technique. We used to take on all sorts of cases together.
Character 6
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: The district's chief prosecutor and my childhood friend. We used to go head-to-head back in his courtroom days.
Character 7
Name: Dumas Gloomsbury
Description: The victim and lead servant of the Sprocket family household. The other servants called him "Mister-Doom-n'-Gloom."
Character 8
Name: Sorin Sprocket
Description: Ellen's fiancé and future president of Sprocket Aviation. He is meticulous about his note taking.
Character 9
Name: Pierce Nichody
Description: The Sprocket family butler. He seems unusually attached to the pocket watch he carries around.
Character 10
Name: Selena Sprocket
Description: Sorin's older sister. She passed away due to her injuries from a car accident.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My all-important badge. Proof of my profession.
Evidence 1
Name: Ellen's Pendant
Description: A pendant worn by Ellen. It seems she received it from her fiancé.
Evidence 2
Name: Ellen's Statement
Description: Ellen saw a suspicious third party on the vista deck when she was being attacked by Gloomsbury.
Evidence 3
Name: Flying Chapel Pamphlet
Description: A pamphlet for the Flying Chapel. It includes a brief introduction and diagrams of its layout.
Evidence 4
Name: Time Keeper
Description: The murder weapon. Dubbed the "Time Keeper," it's a clock with a secret mechanism. The activated Time Keeper. It's obvious that it was in this state when it was used on the victim.
Evidence 5
Name: Broken Lantern
Description: The Pegabull lantern in which the victim's body was found. The lantern in which the victim's body was found. Larry wheeled it from the hold to the reception hall before the reception began. The lantern in which the victim's body was found. Ema restored it, but something about it still seems off. The restored lantern. There's a bloodstain on the inside wheel handle, as if somebody gripped it with a bloody hand.
Evidence 6
Name: Photo of Victim
Description: The victim was discovered inside of the lanterns in the reception hall.
Evidence 7
Name: Gloomsbury's Note
Description: A note found near the victim's body. The writing is smudged as through written by a right-handed person.
Evidence 8
Name: Fog Machine
Description: A device that utilizes dry ice to emit a large amount of thick, fog-like vapor.
Evidence 9
Name: Business Card Wallet
Description: A business card holder with a peculiar yet suspiciously familiar imprint in the center.
Evidence 10
Name: Photo of Reception
Description: A photo of the reception taken by a relative. Much of the reception hall is obscured by thick fog.
Evidence 11
Name: Selena Sprocket Photo
Description: A photo of Sorin's older sister, Selena. It looks like it was taken in some kind of office.
Evidence 12
Name: Larry's Drawing
Description: A drawing Larry made from inside a cabin. It shows a pterodactyl flying outside the window. A drawing Larry made. He probably mistook something for what he claims is a pterodactyl in this picture.
Evidence 13
Name: Photo of Hold
Description: A photo of the hold, stealthily taken by Larry. Ellen can be seen near the center.
Evidence 14
Name: Autopsy Report
Description: Gloomsbury's head shows signs of being hit twice. The Time Keeper was used as the murder weapon.
Evidence 15
Name: Hold Entry Record
Description: A record of the key cards used to access the airship hold.
Evidence 16
Name: Lift Bloodstain
Description: A bloodstain that was found on the side of the lift in the hold. It's unknown whose blood it is. A bloodstain that was found on the side of the lift. It matches the blood on the candelabra.
Evidence 17
Name: Candelabra
Description: A candelabra from the hold bearing the fingerprints of Gloomsbury's left hand, which is his dominant hand. A candelabra from the hold bearing the fingerprints of Gloomsbury's dominant left hand. Traces of blood were found on it. A candelabra from the hold bearing the fingerprints of Gloomsbury's dominant left hand. Stained with the same blood found on the lift.
Evidence 18
Name: Sorin's Notebook
Description: A database-like notebook that chronicles the events of each day in minute detail. A notebook that records Sorin's memories in minute detail. One of the pages has been torn out.
Evidence 19
Name: Newspaper Article
Description: A clipping of a newspaper article detailing the car accident that resulted in Selena Sprocket's death. A clipping of a newspaper article about Selena Sprocket's car accident. Sorin was the one driving.
Evidence 20
Name: Key of Love
Description: A heart-shaped key used to activate the Time Keeper.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: The truth is, I went to the vista deck with Pierce.
Person: Sorin
Testimony 1
Testimony: Pierce heard the commotion, and he came running.
Person: Sorin
Testimony 2
Testimony: That's why my name doesn't appear on the hold entry record.
Person: Sorin
Testimony 3
Testimony: I was badly injured from being stabbed, but I was frantic.
Person: Sorin
Testimony 4
Testimony: The knife wound is quite deep, and continues to throb with pain.
Person: Sorin
Testimony 5
Testimony: By the time we reached the scene, it was all over.
Person: Sorin

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.

Evidence 17 is the candelabra, which is described as having Gloomsbury's left-hand fingerprints (his dominant hand) and blood traces matching the lift bloodstain. Wait, but Sorin's stabbing is with the candelabra, right? But the evidence says the candelabra has Gloomsbury's fingerprints. But if Sorin was stabbed with it, then maybe there's a contradiction here. 

Wait, hold on. The evidence says the candelabra has Gloomsbury's left hand prints (his dominant), but if Sorin was stabbed with that candelabra, then wouldn't the attacker be someone else? But the candelabra has the victim's (Gloomsbury's) fingerprints. But wait, Gloomsbury is the victim here. Wait, no, the victim is Dumas Gloomsbury, according to Character 7. So the candelabra has Gloomsbury's fingerprints, but Sorin is the one who was stabbed with it. Wait, that might not make sense. Because if Gloomsbury was the one holding the candelabra (as per his fingerprints), then he might have been the attacker? But he's the victim in another incident. Hmm. 

Wait, the initial context says Sorin was stabbed with the candelabra. The evidence 17 mentions the candelabra has Gloomsbury's fingerprints (victim's) and blood matching the lift. But Sorin's testimony 3 and 4 talk about being stabbed. If Gloomsbury is the victim (murdered with the Time Keeper, Evidence 4 and 14), then how does that tie in? Wait, maybe there are two separate incidents here. Gloomsbury was killed with the Time Keeper, and Sorin was stabbed with the candelabra. 

But the contradiction here would be if Sorin says he was stabbed with a knife (Testimony 4 mentions a knife wound), but the evidence shows he was stabbed with the candelabra. Because in the context, it's stated that Sorin was stabbed with the candelabra. So Testimony 4 refers to a knife wound, but the actual weapon was the candelabra (Evidence 17). Therefore, that's a contradiction between Testimony 4 (knife) and Evidence 17 (candelabra). 

Wait, but Testimony 4 says "knife wound". The evidence says the candelabra was the weapon. So the testimony mentions a knife, but the evidence shows the candelabra was used. That's a direct contradiction. So Evidence 17 (candelabra) contradicts Testimony 4 (knife wound). Therefore, the answer would be evidence 17 and testimony 4. But let me check the evidence numbers again. 

Evidence 17 is the candelabra. Testimony 4 is "The knife wound is quite deep, and continues to throb with pain." So Sorin claims a knife was used, but the candelabra is the actual weapon. Hence, contradiction. So the pair should be evidence 17 and testimony 4. 

But wait, in the context summary, it's stated that Sorin was stabbed with the candelabra. So his testimony about a knife wound contradicts the actual evidence of the candelabra being the weapon. So yes, that's the contradiction. Therefore, the answer is evidence 17 and testimony 4.

{"evidence": 17, "testimony": 4}

response:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence and testimony from Nichody contradict each other. Let me start by reviewing all the testimonies and evidences provided.

Nichody's testimonies: He claims he hid the body in the spare Pegabull lantern in the hold (Testimony 4). Also, he says he tore the page from Sorin's notebook to protect him (Testimony 5). The relevant evidence here might be Evidence 5, the Broken Lantern. The lantern's description mentions a bloodstain on the inside wheel handle, as if someone gripped it with a bloody hand. If Nichody hid the body in the lantern, he would have had to handle the lantern's wheel, possibly leaving that bloodstain. But wait, Nichody's testimony says the body was still warm when he hid it. If the body was still warm, the blood might not have dried yet. However, the bloodstain on the lantern's handle suggests that someone with blood on their hand touched it. If Nichody moved the body, he might have gotten blood on his hands from the victim's wounds. But the autopsy report (Evidence 14) says the victim was hit twice with the Time Keeper. If the murder happened before Nichody moved the body, then the blood would have been present. So maybe that's not a contradiction.

Looking at another angle. Testimony 3 says Nichody tore the page out of Sorin's notebook to protect him. Evidence 18 is Sorin's Notebook, which mentions a torn page. But Nichody claims he tore it, but according to Evidence 18, the notebook is a database-like chronicle. If Nichody tore the page to hide Sorin's involvement, but Sorin's notebook is meticulous, maybe the torn page's content is important. Wait, but how does that contradict?

Wait, let's check another point. Testimony 4: Nichody hid the body in the spare Pegabull lantern in the hold. Evidence 5 (Broken Lantern) mentions that Larry wheeled it from the hold to the reception hall before the reception began. But if Nichody hid the body in the hold's lantern, then how did the lantern end up in the reception hall? Because Larry moved it before the reception. So maybe the timeline here is conflicting. If Larry moved the lantern before the reception, but Nichody hid the body in the lantern in the hold after the murder, then the body would have been in the lantern that was already moved. That would be a contradiction. Wait, let me clarify the timeline. The murder occurs during the reception? If the lantern was moved to the reception hall before the reception started, and Nichody hid the body in the hold's lantern (spare one), but the body was found in the lantern in the reception hall. So maybe the spare lantern is different. Wait, Evidence 5 says the Pegabull lantern where the body was found was wheeled by Larry from the hold to the reception hall before the reception began. So the body was found in that lantern, which was in the reception hall. But Nichody's testimony says he hid the body in the spare Pegabull lantern in the hold. But if Larry had already moved the lantern to the reception hall, then the spare lantern in the hold would be a different one. But the body was found in the moved lantern. Therefore, Nichody's testimony about hiding the body in the hold's lantern contradicts the evidence that the body was found in the reception hall's lantern, which was moved by Larry. Therefore, Nichody's testimony 4 (hiding in hold's lantern) contradicts Evidence 5 (body found in reception hall lantern). But wait, maybe the hold has multiple lanterns. The Pegabull lantern in the hold was the spare, and Larry moved one to the reception. So Nichody used the spare in the hold, but then how did the body end up in the moved one? Hmm, perhaps not. Alternatively, if Nichody hid the body in the hold's lantern, but the body was found in the reception's lantern, that's a contradiction. Therefore, the testimony 4 (Nichody says he hid the body in the hold's lantern) would conflict with Evidence 6 (Photo of Victim showing the body was discovered in the reception hall's lantern). Or Evidence 5, which states that the lantern in which the victim was found was wheeled by Larry to the reception hall. Therefore, if Nichody hid the body in the hold's lantern, but the body was found in the reception hall's lantern, that's a contradiction. So the testimony 4 (says he hid it in hold's spare) and Evidence 5 (the body was found in the reception hall's lantern) would be conflicting. Therefore, the testimony that he hid the body in the hold's lantern contradicts the evidence that the body was found in the reception hall's lantern. Therefore, the pair would be Evidence 5 and Testimony 4. But I need to check the exact wording. Testimony 4 says "In the hold, I hid the still-warm body in the spare Pegabull lantern." Evidence 5 states "The lantern in which the victim's body was found. Larry wheeled it from the hold to the reception hall before the reception began." So if Larry moved the lantern from the hold to the reception hall before the reception, then the lantern in the reception hall was the one from the hold. So if Nichody hid the body in the hold's spare lantern after the murder, but the body was found in the lantern that was moved to the reception hall before the reception, that's impossible. Therefore, the contradiction is that Nichody claims to have hidden the body in the hold's lantern after the murder, but the body was found in the lantern that was already moved to the reception hall prior to the reception. Therefore, the testimony 4 and Evidence 5 contradict each other. So the answer should be evidence 5 and testimony 4. Let me check the numbering again. Evidence 5 is the Broken Lantern. Testimony 4 is Nichody's statement about hiding in the hold's lantern. Yes. So the JSON would be {"evidence": 5, "testimony": 4}.

{"evidence": 5, "testimony": 4}

First, looking at Nichody's testimonies. Testimony 3 says, "I've never thought of exacting revenge on Master Sorin." Testimony 5 says he was always with others and couldn't have murdered Gloomsbury. The other testimonies are just dots, maybe not filled in yet.

Evidence 11 is a photo of Selena Sprocket. Evidence 19 directly mentions the accident where Sorin was driving. If Nichody was close to Selena, maybe he blames Sorin. If he denies wanting revenge, but there's evidence showing a connection (like Evidence 19), that's a contradiction.

Another angle: Testimony 5 says he was always with others, so he couldn't have committed the murder. But maybe evidence shows he had the opportunity. Let's check evidence about entry records or time. Evidence 15 is Hold Entry Record, which could show if he accessed the crime scene. Or Evidence 5 (Broken Lantern) has a bloodstain on the handle, which might indicate someone moved it. Wait, but the user mentioned the answer must be one pair. Let me check the most direct contradiction. Testimony 3 is about revenge on Sorin. Evidence 19's newspaper article shows Sorin caused Selena's death. If Nichody had a motive tied to Selena (maybe he was close to her), then his denial of wanting revenge is contradicted by Evidence 19. But how direct is that link?

Alternatively, Evidence 17 (Candelabra) has Gloomsbury's left hand prints, but Gloomsbury's note (Evidence 7) was written as if by a right-handed person. That might indicate someone else wrote it. But that's between Gloomsbury and another person, not Nichody.

Wait, Testimony 5: Nichody claims he was always with others, so no opportunity. Evidence 15 (Hold Entry Record) might show his key card was used to access the hold, meaning he could have been there alone. But the Hold Entry Record's exact content isn't specified. If the evidence shows his key was used, that contradicts his alibi. But without knowing the exact content of Evidence 15, maybe that's a stretch.
